page.title: 05POPULATION NEAR STUBHAMPTON
page.content: The land here is either farmed or cultivated as natural woodland or forestry plantation, so there are very few people actually living in the area. Those who are resident are mostly farmers and farm-workers and those otherwise employed in agriculture, and there are a few private dwellings. The houses are isolated and have few amenities in the way of local services. Cottages no longer required for farm-workers are sometimes let on a temporary basis, and the presence of one or two caravans in private gardens suggests a transient summer visitor poulation of relatives and friends. Some agricultural and forestry workers live in neighbouring villages and use their own transport to get to work.
